column3: The goal of education is the advancement of knowledge and the dissemination of truth.

Dogmatism and skepticism are both, in a sense, absolute philosophies; one is certain of knowing, the other of not knowing. What philosophy should dissipate is certainty, whether of knowledge or ignorance.
The goal of education is not to increase the amount of knowledge but to create the possibilities for a child to invent and discover, to create men who are capable of doing new things.

The modern mind is in complete disarray. Knowledge has stretched itself to the point where neither the world nor our intelligence can find any foot-hold. It is a fact that we are suffering from nihilism.
Risk comes from not knowing what you're doing.
The art and science of asking questions is the source of all knowledge.
Knowledge speaks, but wisdom listens.
The control of information is something the elite always does, particularly in a despotic form of government. Information, knowledge, is power. If you can control information, you can control people.
The greatest obstacle to discovery is not ignorance - it is the illusion of knowledge.
Intelligence, knowledge or experience are important and might get you a job, but strong communication skills are what will get you promoted.
Opinion is the medium between knowledge and ignorance.
Ignorance is the curse of God; knowledge is the wing wherewith we fly to heaven.
The improvement of understanding is for two ends: first, our own increase of knowledge; secondly, to enable us to deliver that knowledge to others.
There are in fact two things, science and opinion; the former begets knowledge, the later ignorance.
The true method of knowledge is experiment.
Research is creating new knowledge.

Allah says in the Qur'an not to despise one another. So the criterion in Islam is not color or social status. It's who is most righteous. If I go to a mosque - and I'm a basketball player with money and prestige - if I go to a mosque and see an imam, I feel inferior. He's better than me. It's about knowledge.

People always talk about the implication and applications of a process, but for me, the goal is purely about knowledge. Knowledge can become practical today, in 20 years, or in 500 years. Ask Newton. He didn't know there would be space research based on his accident with the apple.
To acquire knowledge, one must study; but to acquire wisdom, one must observe.
Knowledge is knowing that a tomato is a fruit. Wisdom is knowing not to put it in a fruit salad.
It is beyond a doubt that all our knowledge begins with experience.
The natural desire of good men is knowledge.
Knowledge is power.
Liberty cannot be preserved without general knowledge among the people.
The apple cannot be stuck back on the Tree of Knowledge; once we begin to see, we are doomed and challenged to seek the strength to see more, not less.
The only fence against the world is a thorough knowledge of it.
